alert.note: Alert for Covington; Jefferson Davis; Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 8:30PM CDT until April 13 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Covington County in southeastern Mississippi... Jones County in southeastern Mississippi... Southeastern Jefferson Davis County in south central Mississippi... * Until 930 PM CDT. * At 829 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mount Olive to near Carson, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Hebron around 845 PM CDT. Sanford around 850 PM CDT. Eastabuchie and Moselle around 855 PM CDT. Sandersville and Tuckers Crossing around 900 PM CDT. Mill Creek around 905 PM CDT. Ovett around 910 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Bassfield, Seminary and Soso. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central, central and southeastern Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
